results.title: Australian business achievers (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Shaun Brown, Ivor J. Davies, DECO Corporation and Training Media Services
results.brief_description: Profiles five high achieving Australian business people and their philosophies for success. Those profiled include; Rob Cartwright, Keith Williams, Jodee Rich, Guido Belgiorno and Sam Gance.

results.title: Australian Army at war
results.brief_description: A film telling the story of the Australian Army’s part in the fighting on world battle fronts, from the outbreak of war in 1939 until the surrender of Japan. It depicts the background of the Australian soldier, recruiting and training, embarkation scenes, a coverage of major campaigns, surrender ceremonies, release of prisoners of war and demobilization. No other credits available.

results.title: Australia: the encounter
results.brief_description:
Recounts the story of Matthew Flinder’s circumnavigation around Australia, his trials across the Tasman, involvement with the Nagarrindjeri tribe and his encounters with a French explorer. The Aboriginal people clash with these “white ghosts”. On his way home to England, Flinders is imprisoned in Mauritius and his prized cat, Trim is killed. A decade later, Flinders returns home to his family. Meanwhile, the violence upon Aboriginal sacred lands continues.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Australia in New Guinea
results.brief_description: Traces the development of North East New Guinea under mandate to Australia by the League of Nations. The film contrasts conditions in pre-war years with reconstruction and development during recent years; cutting and milling of timber; construction of pre-fabricated houses and other buildings; education of natives; an experimental project for raising sheep, shearing and weaving wool. No other credits available.

results.title: Australia builds
results.creator_credit: Dept of Public Information and United Nations. Film Board
results.brief_description: Australia is playing her part as a member of the United Nations family by giving a home and new life to many Europeans. But to continue to feed her growing population she has had to develop her resources to a greater extent; the Snowy Mountains project is one way in which she is doing this. Australia has also found it necessary to buy machinery and equipment from dollar countries. Dollars are in short supply, but as a member of the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development, the Government has been able to negotiate a series of dollar loans.

results.title: Australia big beef country
results.brief_description: This film is concerned with local beef production in Australia’s tropics with the emphasis being placed on the use of improved pastures and new breeding stock to improve quality. Hygienic conditions for the production of boneless beef is ensured through government inspection. No other credits available.

results.title: Australia - Colony to Nation
results.brief_description:
Australian Aboriginals sail down a river to be followed by white people from England. People from other nations begin to make their journeys to Australia and the film ends with the Olympic flag and people from all nationalities gathered around it.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: Australia's wonderful wildlife
results.creator_credit: Grant Young and GEO Wildlife Documentaries
results.brief_description: The Australian continent has been isolate for a very long time and its animal inhabitants have evolved in isolation to produce a wildlife community very different from that found anywhere else in the world. This video is a sample of Australia’s unique fauna, with 60 seconds of footage on each animal. Some of the animals will be familiar to everyone, others are not so familiar, but all are distinctively Australian. Animals discussed include: Platypus; Koala; Emu; Kookaburra; Taipan and the Shingleback.

results.title: Australia's remarkable wildlife

results.brief_description: The Australian continent has been isolate for a very long time and its animal inhabitants have evolved in isolation to produce a wildlife community very different from that found anywhere else in the world. This video is a sample of Australias unique fauna, with 60 seconds of footage on each animal. Some of the animals will be familiar to everyone, others are not so familiar, but all are distinctively Australian. Animals discussed include: Lyrebird; Cassowary; Bilby; Bandicoot, Gang-gang and the Quoll.
